          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "The IWYU philosophy maximizes the probability that code continues to compile even with reasonable changes made to interfaces. Clearly, if your code calls a function that is subsequently removed from the published interface, no amount of preparation can prevent changes becoming necessary. This is why changes to APIs are avoided when possible, and why there are deprecation cycles over multiple releases, etc."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }

          "created_by_table": "notion_user",

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "This is a particular problem in C++ because standard headers are allowed to include each other. Source file "
              ],
              ["file.cpp", [["c"]]],
              [" could include one header "],
              ["header1.h", [["c"]]],
              [" that on one platform includes another header "],
              ["header2.h", [["c"]]],
              [". "],
              ["file.cpp", [["c"]]],
              [" might turn out to use the facilities of "],
              ["header2.h", [["c"]]],
              [
                " as well. This wouldn’t be a problem initially - the code would compile because "
              ],
              ["header1.h", [["c"]]],
              [" includes "],
              ["header2.h", [["c"]]],
              [". On another platform, or an upgrade of the current platform, "],
              ["header1.h", [["c"]]],
              [" could be revised so it no longer includes "],
              ["header2.h", [["c"]]],
              [", and then"],
              ["file.cpp", [["c"]]],
              [" would stop compiling as a result."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

          "version": 1

      "cd8be54d-6b03-4586-9471-72f47d62c2f9": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551937235273,
          "id": "cd8be54d-6b03-4586-9471-72f47d62c2f9",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551937235273,
          "parent_id": "1040599b-fc3f-40e8-b5f5-d42509c05bd8",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["Suppose a source file "],
              ["source.c", [["c"]]],
              [" includes a header "],
              ["arbitrary.h", [["c"]]],
              [" which in turn coincidentally includes "],
              ["freeloader.h", [["c"]]],
              [
                ", but the source file also explicitly and independently uses the facilities from "
              ],
              ["freeloader.h", [["c"]]],
              [". All is well to start with. Then one day "],
              ["arbitrary.h", [["c"]]],
              [" is changed so its clients no longer need the facilities of "],
              ["freeloader.h", [["c"]]],
              [". Suddenly, "],
              ["source.c", [["c"]]],
              [
                " stops compiling — because it didn’t meet the IWYU criteria. Because the code in "
              ],
              ["source.c", [["c"]]],
              [" explicitly used the facilities of "],
              ["freeloader.h", [["c"]]],
              [
                ", it should have included what it uses — there should have been an explicit "
              ],
              ["#include \"freeloader.h\"", [["c"]]],
              [" in the source too. ("],
              [
                "Idempotency",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "https://stackoverflow.com/documentation/c/6257/create-and-include-header-files/21638/idempotence"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [" would have ensured there wasn’t a problem.)"]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "e16223c3-400e-4968-bddc-3cc5edf4c5c0": {
